JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Student Assistant for Research Support at the Department of Management, Society and Communication
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
We are looking for a student assistant to assist our researchers with research related task and administrative tasks. As a student assistant, you will be affiliated with a specific researcher and/or research group.

We are 130 fulltime employees at MSC, who all work with research, teaching and/or administration. MSC is located in Dalgas Have, Frederiksberg. You can read more about the department and our research areas at: https://www.cbs.dk/en/research/departments-and-centres/department-of-management-society-and-communication

The tasks can include but are not limited to:
  • Analysing qualitative and/or quantitative data
  • Collecting data
  • Ad Hoc assistance on research projects
  • Administrative tasks such as planning events and applying for grants

Highly-valued qualifications:
  • Fluency in English
  • Great analytical understanding of data
  • Independent and organized
  • Open minded and ready to learn new skills

We can offer a position in a dynamic and fun pace to work. We are an international department and value the different perspectives everyone contributes with to our department.

In order to be considered, your application must include:
  • Short statement of motivation
  • Updated CV
  • Proof of enrollment at an institute of higher education.

Salary and terms of employment
You will be employed at Copenhagen Business School according to the joint agreement between the Ministry of Finance and the Public Employees' Unions (HK-organisationsaftalen) and Fællesoverenskomsten between Finansministeriet and Offentligt Ansatte Organisationer (OAO-S Fællesoverenskomsten).
The salary is between kr. 127 and kr. 133 and is determined by previous occupation in office work and level of education. Pension will be paid if there has been 9 months of previous employment in the public sector, you are 20 years old or had pension in a previous employment. The pension contribution amounts to 11,19% of the pay eligible for pension.

Working hours: 10-15 hours per week

Expected Start: As soon as possible

Should you have any questions do not hesitate to contact HR coordinator Majbritt Vendelbo at mv.msc@cbs.dk

Deadline: 16-05-2022
